results.title: Age is just a number: the concept of time to benefit in older adults.
results.text_hl: A female nursing home resident aged >70 years was admitted to the geriatric ward with de novo @<m>DISEASE_Deglutition_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003680 @@@dysphagia@@@ 6 days after being discharged from the @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ unit.

citations.NLM: Hellemans L, Mertens B, Hias J, Tournoy J, Van der Linden LR. Age is just a number: the concept of time to benefit in older adults. Eur J Hosp Pharm. 2021 Apr 16;():. PMID: 33863810
citations.BibTeX: @article{33863810, title={Age is just a number: the concept of time to benefit in older adults.}, author={Hellemans L and Mertens B and Hias J and Tournoy J and Van der Linden LR}, journal={Eur J Hosp Pharm}}

results.title: Comparative Bioavailability of Metformin Hydrochloride Oral Solution Versus Metformin Hydrochloride Tablets in Fasting Mexican Healthy Volunteers.
results.text_hl: ...INTRODUCTION: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ tablets may be challenging to swallow not only for those @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Deglutition_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003680 @@@dysphagia@@@ but also for children and the elderly.

citations.NLM: Garza-Ocañas L, González-Canudas J, Tamez-de la O E, Badillo-Castañeda C, Gómez-Meza MV, Romero-Antonio Y, Molina-Pérez A, Amador-Hernández AG. Comparative Bioavailability of Metformin Hydrochloride Oral Solution Versus Metformin Hydrochloride Tablets in Fasting Mexican Healthy Volunteers. Adv Ther. 2019 Feb;36(2):407-415. PMID: 30565181
citations.BibTeX: @article{30565181, title={Comparative Bioavailability of Metformin Hydrochloride Oral Solution Versus Metformin Hydrochloride Tablets in Fasting Mexican Healthy Volunteers.}, author={Garza-Ocañas L and González-Canudas J and Tamez-de la O E and Badillo-Castañeda C and Gómez-Meza MV and Romero-Antonio Y and Molina-Pérez A and Amador-Hernández AG}, journal={Adv Ther}, volume={36}, number={2}, pages={407-415}}

results.title: Practical Insights Into Improving Adherence to Metformin Therapy in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes.
results.text_hl: IN BRIEF Adherence to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-based treatment regimens for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@ is currently suboptimal due to a complex array of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@-, treatment-, and physician-related barriers, including physical and psychological @<m>DISEASE_Deglutition_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003680 @@@swallowing difficulties@@@ associated with large tablets and @DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal disturbances@@@.

citations.NLM: Christofides EA. Practical Insights Into Improving Adherence to Metformin Therapy in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes. Clin Diabetes. 2019 Jul;37(3):234-241. PMID: 31371854
citations.BibTeX: @article{31371854, title={Practical Insights Into Improving Adherence to Metformin Therapy in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes.}, author={Christofides EA}, journal={Clin Diabetes}, volume={37}, number={3}, pages={234-241}}
